</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Economy: </strong></span><span>Into congressional testimonies? Soak it all in today. Fed Chair Jerome Powell and Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin will </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-21/powell-and-mnuchin-set-to-get-grilled-on-need-for-more-stimulus?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">face questions</a></span><span> from a House committee over the government’s response to the coronavirus-induced recession.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Also in D.C...</strong></span><span>President Trump said he’ll </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/086441a07762d054b836251a309b3df7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announce</a></span><span> his pick to fill the Supreme Court vacancy, which opened following the death of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, by Saturday. Meanwhile, the two parties are bickering about a </span><span><a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/09/21/hill-leaders-race-to-resurrect-stopgap-spending-deal-419371?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spending plan</a></span><span> to avoid a government shutdown at the end of the month.</span>

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/21/us-stocks-fall-china-pandemic-political-tensions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Markets Take Fall Preparations Way Too Literally
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Stocks going down" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDgzL3N0b2Nrc19nb2luZ19kb3duLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before reading, take a quick glance back at the markets section. We regret to inform you that red = bad. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.S. stocks succumbed to peer pressure yesterday and followed their international counterparts in <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/21/stock-sell-off-accelerates-and-is-expected-to-get-worse-before-it-gets-better.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">logging steep losses</a>. Oil took a dive and yields on 10-year Treasury notes also fell as investors craving stability hopped into the safe-haven asset.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s dragging the market down</h2>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> Pandemic. </strong></span><span>The U.S. is about to pass 200,000 coronavirus-related deaths. In Europe, where cases are </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/4bb42f59ba2ac88f5e39f3eceed1797f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">also rising</a></span><span> in several countries, the UK is on track to log almost 50,000 new cases per </span><span><em>day</em></span><span> by mid-October if the current trend continues. As the British government weighs stricter measures like a </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/21/uk-coronavirus-latest-mini-national-lockdown-considered-by-governmen.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">second lockdown</a></span><span>, spooked investors sent travel and bank stocks sinking.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">China. </strong></span><span>Over the weekend, Beijing </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/21/china-releases-details-on-unreliable-entity-list-raising-uncertainty-for-foreign-businesses.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released penalties</a></span><span> for its “unreliable entities” list, which will target foreign individuals and companies whose actions are viewed as a threat to Chinese interests. Penalties could include fines or restrictions on work permits, investments, and trade.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> Politics: </strong></span><span>The U.S. is 42 days out from the election, but investors are prepping for a drawn-out result that could </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/21/investing/stock-market-election-outcome/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take months</a></span><span>. And with renewed partisan fighting over the late RBG’s open Supreme Court seat, a congressional compromise on another round of pandemic relief looks quite unlikely before Nov. 3. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> Scandal: </strong></span><span>Sunday’s </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/21/report-concludes-banks-shuffled-allegedly-dirty-money-around-globe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bombshell report</a></span><span> that major banks continued to move large sums of dirty money despite red flags was another blow for financial stocks already bruised by falling bond yields and near-zero interest rates for the foreseeable future. HSBC shares hit a 25-year low.</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Now entering their fourth consecutive week of declines, the S&P is down over 6%, the Dow 4.5%, and the Nasdaq 8.5% for the month of September. The S&P, which had its best August since 1986, is now on track for its worst September in nine years.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/21/microsoft-buys-game-studio-bethesda-softworks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Microsoft Buys Some Videogames
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Microsoft swiping" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDgxL21pY3Jvc29mdF9zd2lwaW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Microsoft announced plans to <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/09/21/microsoft-set-to-acquire-bethesda-parent-zenimax-for-7-5b/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acquire ZeniMax</a>, the parent company of videogame studio Bethesda Softworks, for $7.5 billion. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s not quite TikTok </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But it comes with a lot fewer headaches...and popular gaming titles like <em>Elder Scrolls</em>, <em>Doom</em>, <em>Fallout</em>, <em>Dishonored</em>, and <em>Starfield</em>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The acquisition highlights Microsoft’s shift toward a subscription-based gaming model ahead of the November 10 release of its two new Xbox consoles. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Before...</strong></span><span>Microsoft valued exclusivity. It made its biggest games, like the </span><span><em>Halo</em></span><span> series, playable only for people who owned an Xbox.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Now...</strong></span><span>Microsoft doesn’t care as much about where you play its games, the Verge </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/21449178/microsoft-xbox-bethesda-zenimax-media-acquisition-xbox-game-pass?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a></span><span>. What’s important is that subscribers to Microsoft’s subscription service, Game Pass, get first access to the most popular games.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Buying Bethesda allows Microsoft to cut down on costly licensing fees and revenue sharing agreements with other studios. Its new recipe for success? Feeding its <a href="https://www.engadget.com/xbox-game-pass-15-million-subscribers-150418077.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">15 million</a> Xbox Game Pass subscribers a healthy diet of popular games made in-house.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here:</strong> Go deeper into Microsoft’s plans for dominating cloud videogaming with our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/10/cloud-gaming-big-tech-streaming-wars?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">breakdown</a> of all the major players. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/21/nikola-executive-chairman-trevor-milton-steps?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Rise and Fall of Trevor Milton
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, mostly the fall. Nikola founder and Executive Chairman Trevor Milton <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/21/investing/nikola-trevor-milton/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stepped down</a> from the electric automaker yesterday because battling an onslaught of fraud accusations makes work feel a lot more like...work.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>In the spring, Nikola went public via reverse merger and its shares surged despite never having sold a vehicle. It received another stamp of approval when GM announced a $2 billion investment to co-develop Nikola’s electric trucks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But on September 10, short-seller Hindenburg Research wrote a scathing report attacking Nikola and Milton for misleading investors. The SEC and DOJ are now investigating.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>This isn’t a Theranos-style collapse...yet. GM is <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nikola-chairman-general-motors/gm-bosch-stick-with-nikola-alliances-despite-miltons-exit-idUSKCN26C2PF?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sticking with</a> Nikola, and even though the electric automaker's shares dropped 19% yesterday, its market capitalization remains over $10 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, Hindenburg’s founder Nathan Anderson is watching Nikola’s descent into chaos like the Joker. Milton leaving is “only the beginning of Nikola’s unraveling,” he said yesterday. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Don’t forget: Hindenburg stands to make money from a drop in Nikola’s share price.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>former GM vice chairman and Nikola board member Steve Girsky will take over immediately. Good luck, sir.</p>

Get Money Management From a Virtual Pro

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But get this—before you pay a dime, Digital Advisor really <strong style="color:#000">gets to know you and comes up with a personalized investment strategy</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You'll start with a risk quiz that digs into the tradeoff between making and losing money. The outcome: your "risk attitude." </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/21/youre-worth-119-trillion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You’re Worth $119 Trillion*
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="money" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTYxL3ByaW1hcnkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ian McKinnon</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">*Together with all other U.S. households. In Q2, the net worth of American families <a href="https://apnews.com/28a44dd1a025d9b9af5a8d4ff8c5a033?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose 7%</a> to an all-time high, according to Fed data released yesterday.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Household wealth = money in your bank accounts + assets (like stocks and real estate) - liabilities (loans or credit card debt). </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That record jump follows a record crash in Q1 because of the pandemic. Sounds like good news for the economic recovery...right?</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It's complicated</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As stock indexes rebounded in Q2, wealth held in stocks saw the biggest gains, padding household portfolios by $5.7 trillion. But not everyone shared in the returns.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While over a third of the richest 1% own corporate equities, only 7% of the middle 50%–90% and just 2% of the bottom half do.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Households in the bottom half are more likely to own real estate (54%) than other asset classes. But home values only increased $500 billion in Q2 compared to the trillions gained in the stock market.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This data underscores fears of a <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90549147/forget-u-or-v-or-w-we-may-be-headed-toward-a-k-shaped-recovery?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">K-shaped recovery</a>—where the “haves” bounce back but things get worse for the “have-nots.”</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F09%2F21%2Fyoure-worth-119-trillion" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/21/short-form-video-app-quibi-reportedly-exploring-possible-sale?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Quibi Can't Sell Subscriptions but It Might Sell Itself
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Hamlet holding Quibi" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjg0L3F1aWJpX2hhbWxldC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Toby Howell</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’re not in <em>Groundhog Day</em>, but another short-form video app could be up for sale. Quibi is weighing “<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/quibi-explores-strategic-options-including-a-possible-sale-11600707806?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strategic options</a>” after falling well short of its subscriber targets, the WSJ reports.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To figure out where a company backed by nearly $1.8 billion in funding stumbled, we <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1308094089544347648?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked</a> our Twitter followers...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 1.38;"><span style="text-decoration: none;"> <img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDgyL21iX3R3ZWV0X2Fib3V0X3F1aWJpLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></span></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Confusing branding:</strong></span><span> “The name. It doesn't convey what the service, you know, actually does”—Chris Cillizza</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Misjudged the market: </strong></span><span>“It solved a problem nobody had”—Matt Gibbons</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Didn’t leverage its users:</strong></span><span> “Failed to democratize content creation for a generation of content creators”—Edgar Rodriguez</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bad content:</strong></span><span> “Its slate of shows resembled a list of rejected </span><span><em>30 Rock</em></span><span> one-liners”—Maura Johnston</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Everything is on the table, per the WSJ, from going public through a SPAC to being acquired by a media/tech giant like Disney or Amazon.</p>

We regret to inform you that red = bad. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eU.S. stocks succumbed to peer pressure yesterday and followed their international counterparts in \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/21/stock-sell-off-accelerates-and-is-expected-to-get-worse-before-it-gets-better.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elogging steep losses\u003c/a\u003e. Oil took a dive and yields on 10-year Treasury notes also fell as investors craving stability hopped into the safe-haven asset.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s dragging the market down\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e Pandemic. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. is about to pass 200,000 coronavirus-related deaths. In Europe, where cases are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/4bb42f59ba2ac88f5e39f3eceed1797f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealso rising\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in several countries, the UK is on track to log almost 50,000 new cases per \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eday\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e by mid-October if the current trend continues. As the British government weighs stricter measures like a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/21/uk-coronavirus-latest-mini-national-lockdown-considered-by-governmen.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecond lockdown\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, spooked investors sent travel and bank stocks sinking.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eChina. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOver the weekend, Beijing \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/21/china-releases-details-on-unreliable-entity-list-raising-uncertainty-for-foreign-businesses.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased penalties\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for its “unreliable entities” list, which will target foreign individuals and companies whose actions are viewed as a threat to Chinese interests. Penalties could include fines or restrictions on work permits, investments, and trade.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e Politics: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. is 42 days out from the election, but investors are prepping for a drawn-out result that could \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/21/investing/stock-market-election-outcome/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etake months\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. And with renewed partisan fighting over the late RBG’s open Supreme Court seat, a congressional compromise on another round of pandemic relief looks quite unlikely before Nov. 3. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e Scandal: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSunday’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/21/report-concludes-banks-shuffled-allegedly-dirty-money-around-globe?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebombshell report\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that major banks continued to move large sums of dirty money despite red flags was another blow for financial stocks already bruised by falling bond yields and near-zero interest rates for the foreseeable future. HSBC shares hit a 25-year low.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eNow entering their fourth consecutive week of declines, the S\u0026P is down over 6%, the Dow 4.5%, and the Nasdaq 8.5% for the month of September. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Microsoft announced plans to \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/09/21/microsoft-set-to-acquire-bethesda-parent-zenimax-for-7-5b/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s not quite TikTok \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut it comes with a lot fewer headaches...and popular gaming titles like \u003cem\u003eElder Scrolls\u003c/em\u003e, \u003cem\u003eDoom\u003c/em\u003e, \u003cem\u003eFallout\u003c/em\u003e, \u003cem\u003eDishonored\u003c/em\u003e, and \u003cem\u003eStarfield\u003c/em\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe acquisition highlights Microsoft’s shift toward a subscription-based gaming model ahead of the November 10 release of its two new Xbox consoles. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBefore...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMicrosoft valued exclusivity. It made its biggest games, like the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eHalo\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e series, playable only for people who owned an Xbox.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNow...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMicrosoft doesn’t care as much about where you play its games, the Verge \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/21449178/microsoft-xbox-bethesda-zenimax-media-acquisition-xbox-game-pass?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. What’s important is that subscribers to Microsoft’s subscription service, Game Pass, get first access to the most popular games.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Buying Bethesda allows Microsoft to cut down on costly licensing fees and revenue sharing agreements with other studios. Its new recipe for success? Feeding its \u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/xbox-game-pass-15-million-subscribers-150418077.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e15 million\u003c/a\u003e Xbox Game Pass subscribers a healthy diet of popular games made in-house.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here:\u003c/strong\u003e Go deeper into Milton\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, mostly the fall. Nikola founder and Executive Chairman Trevor Milton \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/21/investing/nikola-trevor-milton/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estepped down\u003c/a\u003e from the electric automaker yesterday because battling an onslaught of fraud accusations makes work feel a lot more like...work.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eIn the spring, Nikola went public via reverse merger and its shares surged despite never having sold a vehicle. It received another stamp of approval when GM announced a $2 billion investment to co-develop Nikola’s electric trucks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut on September 10, short-seller Hindenburg Research wrote a scathing report attacking Nikola and Milton for misleading investors. The SEC and DOJ are now investigating.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThis isn’t a Theranos-style collapse...yet. GM is \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nikola-chairman-general-motors/gm-bosch-stick-with-nikola-alliances-despite-miltons-exit-idUSKCN26C2PF?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esticking with\u003c/a\u003e Nikola, and even though the electric automaker's shares dropped 19% yesterday, its market capitalization remains over $10 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, Hindenburg’s founder Nathan Anderson is watching Nikola’s descent into chaos like the Joker. Milton leaving is “only the beginning of Nikola’s unraveling,” he said yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDon’t forget: Hindenburg stands to make money from a drop in Nikola’s share price.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eformer GM vice chairman and Nikola board member Steve Girsky will take over immediately.
